author: brane
msg: The Windows resource compiler is extremely particular about where it will
look for include files. When it sees the form "#include <...>", it *only*
looks at the files in the global INCLUDE path, and ignores /I options.
so that the resource compiler doesn't choke on the <...> include there.

author: cmpilato
msg: (file_xfer_under_path): Fix compiler warning: passing arg 3 of
`svn_io_copy_file' makes integer from pointer without a cast.

author: sussman
msg: Have updates use diff3 instead of diff+patch.  Simplify
svn_wc_install_file() to use the shiny new svn_wc_merge() routine, and
rewrite conflict logic to create and track three fulltext conflict files
This massive patch brought to you by Karl Fogel, Ben Collins-Sussman,
the letter J, and the number 5.
(svn_io_run_diff3): fix brain-o, and use better default labels.
Also, capture stdout to tmpfile, then use it to overwrite the target
file.  Make 3-part conflict markers the default;  this can be
(svn_wc_merge):  tweak interface:  require 3 basenames within a
common parent.  [this is what the caller already has, and this is
what svn_io_run_diff3 requires.  so why is the man-in-the-middle
(svn_wc_conflicted_p):  rewrite to look for the new conflict files.
(revert_admin_things): revert the new conflict file attributes.
(log_do_committed):  remove the new conflict file attributes.
(log_do_file_xfer): don't take translation args;  just use current
prop vals, and always expand in the forward direction.
(start_handler): parse cp_and_translate command, and merge command too.
(file_xfer_under_path): handle both regular and translated copies,
and query translation props internally now.  Try to be more
loggily "idempotent" with certain cp and mv commands.
(log_do_merge):  new log func to call svn_wc_merge.
(svn_wc_merge): when diff3 finds a conflict, mark entry 'Conflicted'
and start tracking 3 backup files.  tweak to match new interface of
getting 3 basenames within a common parent dir.
(svn_wc_install_file):  simplify and use svn_wc_merge loggily.  much better!
* svn-test2.sh:  don't try to remove *.rej files;  remove pi.* instead.
(basic_merge): change this test to expect a new '\n' at the end of
the merged-text.  Apparently diff3 is doing this, whereas diff+patch
didn't.  This might need more analysis: is diff3 perhaps "more
(basic_conflict): change this test to expect 3-way conflict markers
in the conflicted file, and to expect the 3 fulltext backups.
* CHANGES:  mention conflict markers as new user-visible behavior.
